Problem:
Analyze a system governed by the partial differential equation \\( \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} + c \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial x} = 0 \\), where \\( u(x,t) \\) represents the state of the system and c is a constant wave speed. Consider the effect of applying a Fourier transform transformation defined by \\( F(u) = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} u(x,t) e^{-ikx} dx \\).

If at some time \\( t_1 \\) within the interval [0,T], an intervention changing c to a different constant wave speed \\( c' \\) is applied, will the state of the system \\( u(x,T) \\) at T > t_1 depend solely on the original wave speed c?
Explanation: The new wave speed \\( c' \\) from \\( t_1 \\) onward alters the propagation characteristics of the system, and hence the state at T would be dependent on both c and \\( c' \\), indicating a dependency on both the initial conditions manipulated by \\( F(u) \\) and modified propagation characteristics due to the change in wave speed.
